title: Mechanical and Machinery hazards | Contact With Moving Parts of Equipment

tasks.task: Understanding and preventing injury from contact with moving parts of construction equipment
subtasks: Recognizing that contact with moving parts can cause serious injuries (e.g., 20 deaths, 300 amputations, and over a thousand fractures annually)
Applying zero-tolerance risk management for injuries from moving parts
Identifying machinery with moving parts on a construction site
Ensuring that high-risk machinery (machines where moving parts must be 100% inaccessible) are fully guarded and have no access during operation
Equipping other machinery with guards or safety devices to prevent contact with moving parts during operation
Regularly inspecting safety devices for integrity and proper operation
Reporting and addressing any defects or malfunctions in safety devices immediately
Understanding the consequences of removing or blocking safety devices
Adhering to maintenance procedures that require unplugging or removing batteries before service
Implementing lockout procedures when necessary during maintenance
Ensuring proper operation of equipment by trained workers who follow preventive measures and safety rules
Promoting a culture of safety and accountability through worker training and adherence to site protocols

tasks.task: Recognize the severity of injuries caused by moving parts (e.g., 20 deaths, 300 amputations annually).
subtasks: Understand the statistics and the critical nature of these injuries.
Adopt a zero-tolerance policy for injuries from moving parts.
Be aware of the machinery present on construction sites with moving parts.

tasks.task: Ensure that high-risk machinery (where moving parts must be 100% inaccessible) is fully guarded and inaccessible during operation.
subtasks: Equip these machines with guards or other safety devices that prevent any access.

tasks.task: Equip other machinery with guards or safety devices to prevent contact with moving parts during operation.
subtasks: Implement appropriate safety measures for machinery where moving parts cannot be entirely inaccessible during operation.

tasks.task: Regularly check safety devices to ensure they are in good condition and functioning properly.
subtasks: Inspect guards, safety devices, and other protective measures on a consistent basis.
Immediately report any defects or malfunctions in safety devices and address them promptly.
Understand the consequences of removing or blocking safety devices, and never do so.

tasks.task: When performing maintenance that requires equipment to be stopped, unplug it or remove the battery.
subtasks: Follow necessary steps to disconnect power sources safely.

tasks.task: Implement lockout procedures during maintenance that requires service on moving parts.
subtasks: Use proper lockout/tagout protocols to ensure safety during maintenance.

tasks.task: Ensure operators are properly trained and follow all preventive measures and safety rules.
subtasks: Ensure that all personnel are well-trained and adhering to safety protocols.

tasks.task: Foster a culture of safety through training, adherence to protocols, and continuous education.
subtasks: Encourage a proactive approach to safety across the construction site.
